entail.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to involve something as a necessary part or result
entail.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
The journey will entail changing trains twice.
entail.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if you entail property, you arrange for it to be given to a specific person, usually your oldest son, when you die
entail.translation[1].definitions[0].def: when ownership of land and property can only pass to a certain person, especially the oldest son, when the owner dies
entail.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Until the eighteenth century aristocratic landed property was generally governed by entail, which worked to secure large estates.
